chapter_title: USE SELECTIVE HONESTY AND GENEROSITY TO DISARM YOUR VICTIM
summary: In this chapter, Robert Greene explores the powerful strategy of using selective honesty and acts of generosity to disarm and manipulate others. Genuine expressions of honesty can lower defenses, allowing for deception under a guise of sincerity. The chapter highlights the story of Count Victor Lustig and his audacious con of Al Capone as a prime example of this tactic. Greene emphasizes that a well-timed gesture of kindness can distract and disarm even the most skeptical individuals. By demonstrating an unexpected act of generosity, one can more effectively pursue ulterior motives. Ultimately, the chapter articulates the importance of cunning in achieving power through strategic acts of perceived goodness.

slides.section_body: A single act of sincerity can mask numerous dishonest actions. Embracing open-hearted honesty can lower the defenses of even the most skeptical individuals, allowing for manipulation when their guard is down.
slides.quote: One sincere and honest move will cover over dozens of dishonest ones.

slides.section_title: The Con of Count Victor Lustig
slides.section_body: Count Victor Lustig executed a remarkable con on Al Capone by exuding elegance and charm. His reputation for apparent honesty led Capone to trust him, resulting in Lustig making off with $50,000.
Distraction is key in deception. Acts of kindness can shift perceptions, creating a window through which manipulation can occur unnoticed. Generosity often masks ulterior motives.
slides.quote: The essence of deception is distraction.

slides.section_body: The ancient principle of 'giving before taking' illustrates that making a generous gesture can ease confrontation. This technique creates a favorable disposition, making it harder for others to be resentful.
slides.quote: When you are about to take, you should give.

slides.section_body: First impressions are critical—once someone perceives you as honest, it is difficult to change that perception. A reputation for honesty allows manipulation to happen more easily.
slides.quote: Selective honesty is best employed on your first encounter.

slides.section_body: Throughout history, cunning individuals like Duc Wu manipulated relationships through honorable gestures, resulting in victory. Such strategies highlight that appearances can often be deceiving.
slides.quote: Honesty is one of the best ways to disarm the wary.

slides.section_body: Gifts can evoke childlike excitement, rendering us vulnerable to manipulation. Recognizing that generous gestures may conceal ulterior motives challenges our assumptions about altruism.
slides.quote: A gift brings out the child in us.

slides.section_body: The iconic Trojan Horse underscores the notion that the most successful deceptions can be hidden within gestures of kindness. This tactic can lead to unexpected advantages in power struggles.
slides.quote: One gift did more for the Greek cause than ten years of fighting.

slides.section_body: Acts of selective kindness can disarm even the most resolute opponents. By appealing to emotions, such gestures can undermine resistance and foster cooperation or compliance.
slides.quote: Calculated acts of kindness can turn a Capone into a gullible child.

slides.section_body: Conversely, if deceitful behavior is your past, honesty can become a liability. In such scenarios, embracing a rogue persona can prove more effective, demonstrating the fluid nature of trust.
slides.quote: Nothing in the realm of power is set in stone.
